All HTTP Requests.description: This method is like the standard app.METHOD() methods, except it matches all HTTP verbs.

HTTP DELETE Requests.description: Routes HTTP DELETE requests to the specified path with the specified callback functions.

App Disable.description: Sets the Boolean setting name to false, where name is one of the properties from the app settings table.

App Disabled.description: Returns true if the Boolean setting name is disabled (false), where name is one of the properties from the app settings table.

App Enable.description: Sets the Boolean setting name to true, where name is one of the properties from the app settings table.

App Enabled.description: Returns true if the setting name is enabled (true), where name is one of the properties from the app settings table.

App Engine.description: Registers the given template engine callback as ext.

App Param.description: Add callback triggers to route parameters, where name is the name of the parameter or an array of them, and callback is the callback function.

App Path.description: Returns the canonical path of the app, a string.

App Render.description: Returns the rendered HTML of a view via the callback function.

App Route.description: Returns an instance of a single route, which you can then use to handle HTTP verbs with optional middleware.

App Listen.description: Starts a UNIX socket and listens for connections on the given path. This method is identical to Node’s http.Server.listen()

App Listen With Callback.description: Starts a UNIX socket and listens for connections on the given path. This method is identical to Node’s http.Server.listen()

App Use.description: Mounts the specified middleware function or functions at the specified path.
